result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrek J. Buerger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week. If not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.

No contact with B.K.
No dangerous weapons.

SAFE assessment and follow up.
Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrek J. Buerger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Derrek J. Buerger
Current: 3604 Ross ave Apt 8, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 03-23-2016)
Prior: 1500 1st Street Apt 123, Wausau, WI 54403 United States
and Reimbursement to County - includes 15CM1052 & 15CM1292 - signed by Judge on 3/17/16
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:55 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM1052 AND 15CM1292. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Zachary Glascock. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM1052: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1292: Ct. 2 (DC/Use of Dangerous Weapon/DA)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM1052: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM1292: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
B.K. makes statement. 
Argument re: expungement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation- CONDITIONS: SAFE assessment and follow up; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no dangerous weapons; no contact with B.K; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 2 DA surcharges. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 1 day jail credit in 15CM1052 and NO days jail credit in 15CM1292 if revoked. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT finds def eligible to petition for expungement only upon successful completion of probation and no additional crimes for which probable cause has been found within the next 10 years. 

Adj: 2:17 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:01 am 
Dft. Appears. 
Deft states he was sent letter from public defender indicating he was not eligible for their representation.
Deft states he has court appointed attorney in another open case.  
Court questions Dft. RE: Employment/Income.
Court appts Atty Zachary Glascock @ $70/hr. not to exceed $700 w/o further order of the Court.
Adj: 11:04 am 
 
C: Br. 3

Indigency hearing at 07-28-2015 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-10-2015 09:00 am.
Case Called: 10:49am. Clerk: Denise. Dft. does not appear. Court denies Request for Indigency. C: Br. 3. Adjourned; 10:49am.
